3631925600.resolved_title: Why your favourite colour is probably blue
3631925600.excerpt: In 1993, crayon-maker Crayola conducted an unscientific, but intriguing poll: it asked US children to name their favourite crayon colour. Most chose a fairly standard blue, but three other blue shades also made the top 10 list.   Seven years later, the firm repeated its experiment.

1.caption: Despite the wide array of crayons on offer, children will often reach for a preferred colour time after time

2.caption: Perhaps surprisingly, our preference for colour changes as we get older, largely due to our experiences in the world around us

3.caption: If your choice of colour makes you stand out from the crowd, it could say something about how sensation seeking you are
